characters: AND WE CUT RIGHT BACK TO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cars are at a standstill. It's a horrific traffic jam. Morning rush hour. Sun beating down, asphalt shimmering i heat. The blown-out downtown L.A. skyline hovers in the distance. We DRIFT past more CARS. Hear one snippet of audio after another... One driver taps his steering wheel to PROG ROCK. Another sings to OPERA. A third raps along to a HIP-HOP track. We move from a RADIO INTERVIEW to a FRENCH BALLAD to TECHNO, until finally we begin to hear... ...a new, original piece of music... [ANOTHER DAY OF SUN] We settle on the CAR from which this new tune is playing. The driver is a YOUNG WOMAN. She hums along to the riff o her radio -- then starts SINGING. Then -- she EXITS her car. Then -- she starts MOVING down lane. One by one, more DRIVERS join her -- SINGING and DANCING along. Without a single cut, we've found ourselves in a F FLEDGED MUSICAL NUMBER... Drivers leap on car-tops, dance Jerome Robbins-style, mak use of the road and the hot gleam of the automobiles. Arm swaying, feet banging, dancers darting, as the MUSIC blas We WEAVE and SWIRL and DART between and around the cars, taking the magic in... Finally -- all the drivers swing back into their vehicles and the song comes to a dramatic stop. Flash title card:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A1   We settle on a new car. A 1983 Dodge Riviera. In it SEBASTIAN, 32, L.A. native. He's listening to the radio. playing a track on his music system -- a tape of Thelonio Monk's "Japanese Folk Song". But he keeps stopping it, ov and over and over -- always rewinding to the same exact s Revision                           2.

dialogues.speaker: B1 OMIT
dialogues.text: C1   We DRIFT from his car to one further up ahead. A lig 2005 Prius. Inside is MIA, 27, Nevada-raised. Six years o "no" in L.A. have toughened her, but she's still a dreame She seems to be on the phone, speaking into her car's sys Fast, fiery, full of energy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and I swear to God, she was wrecked. It was pure insanity. Mia stops. Thinks. Mutters to herself: "Insanity"... Then leans down and grabs a piece of paper from the passenger seat. It's a SCRIPT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading now)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pure lunacy. Oh God, I know... Just then -- the traffic around Mia starts to let up. She too focused on her lines to notice. Then -- a long, sustained honk behind her: AHHHHHHHHHHHHH Mia comes to. Jerked back to reality. The honking car beh her swerves into the next lane. It's Sebastian. Mia gives the finger. We then FOLLOW her as she drives...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia works, photos of Hollywood icons on the wall behind h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This doesn't taste like almond milk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, it is. I know sometimes it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I see the carton? Mia hands it over. The Customer looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have a black coffee. Mia gets the coffee. Quickly sneaks a look at a script hi underneath her counter. The same one we saw in her car... Revision                          3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands the coffee to the Customer. We follow the Custo out through the door -- as a WOMAN walks into the shop. W don't see the Woman's face, but we see all the eyes in th shop turn immediately to her. We see one CUSTOMER whisper another, discreetly pointing as the WOMAN passes by...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cappuccino, please. Mia nods. Gets it made. The Manager takes it from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I insist. She pays. Then smiles at Mia and drops a bill in the tip Mia watches as the Woman walks off, is joined by a STUDIO EMPLOYEE on a golf cart outside -- we realize this coffee is on a STUDIO LOT -- and is driven away... Then -- Mia's phone rings. It reads: "MOM". Mia presses "IGNORE" and the time pops up on the phone's screen: 4:07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Removing her apron and hurrying out, turning back as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you think you're going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's -- five past...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd better be here early tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok. -- then realizes she doesn't have her script, runs back t grab it, hurries on and then -- CRASHES into a table. Cof and food spill all over her shirt, and all at once we're

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia's in a thick winter coat, covering her stained shirt. her cell, loudly laughing while her adrenaline surges --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I swear to God, she was wrecked. It was pure lunacy. Oh God, I know... Revision                      4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her nerves are practically visible. As she talks, we PULL BACK -- to see that she's auditioning for a CASTING DIREC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, Turner's fine. So you -- are you waiting `til Denver to tell her...? (as her smile contracts)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. I see... (silence; she clenches her jaw...)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're right. I understand. (...and a tear falls from her eye)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok... I just... Oh... An ASSISTANT appears through the glass on the door behind Mia, waving to the Casting Director: Yoohoo. Can I come i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying now)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm happy for you... I -- I just --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One second. Mia stops. The Casting Director waves the Assistant in. T Assistant scurries in, shows her boss a post-it. Mia stan there, trying to hold onto the tears, hold onto the emoti the Casting Director reads the post-it and thinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I'll call her back. Tell her I'm almost done in here. The Assistant nods. Walks out. Mia waits, trying to maint

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what? I think we're good. Thanks for coming in. Mia looks at her. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia exits. Nerves still on edge. Passes one beautiful red after the next -- all getting ready to cry. Enters the elevator with two other WOMEN -- tall, statues Also redheads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia enters. Exhausted. Heads to her ROOM. Revision                          5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old movie posters hang on the walls, including a big Ingr Bergman one over the bed. There's also a shelf filled wit acting books -- Uta Hagen, Stella Adler. Various other trinkets: an old globe, an old blue-and-red suitcase. Mia takes off her shoe. A blister on her sole. 8   WE CUT TO: Mia in the BATHROOM. Just showered, wrappe towel. She hums to herself. The mirror is fogged up. She turns off the vent. The mist the glass thickens. She dabs some of it away. Dims the lights. Looks... With the fog in place, her reflection looks like one of t soft-focus old Hollywood close-ups. She hums as she brush her hair... Then -- the door SWINGS open -- and the spell is broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy Mother of God. Mia snaps out of it. Turns. Fog is enveloping TRACY, 27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever heard of a vent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to give you an entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (appearing in the hall, 26, eating Cheetos)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia! How'd it go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same here. Was Jen there? Or Rachel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know who Jen and Rachel are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're the worst.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if they were there. As Mia slips away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet they were. Revision                           6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (appearing, 27)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is there a convention in the bathroom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two minutes, people! Mia you're coming, right? WE PAN TO find Mia poking her head out of her bedroom --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't. Working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? (we PAN BACK to Tracy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did she say "working"? A8   We follow Mia INSIDE her room. She closes the door. moment. You can tell in her eyes -- work or not, a night the town is the last thing she wants to do now. B8   WE CUT to the HALLWAY, to find Tracy POUNDING on Mia

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (opening up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I know things didn't go well today. There are four things in my inbox that you're perfect for and I will submit you. But right now -- you're coming. C8   With that -- she barges in and beelines to Mia's clo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be a bunch of social climbers packed into one of those glass houses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. Fun. She pulls out a blue dress. As Alexis hurries in --

dialogues.speaker: TRACY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This looks familiar.             I was going to give it back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexis moves from Mia's perfume to the dress, lighting up she grabs it -- Revision                           7.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Mia. When else do you get to see every Hollywood clichГ© crammed into a single home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (faux-offended)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lex! I'm disappointed in you. There's nothing to make fun of. This party will be humanity at its finest. Mia rolls her eyes -- and, with that -- Tracy BREAKS INTO SONG. [SOMEONE IN THE CROWD] She play-acts the clichГ©s this party will represent. Ale and Caitlin join in, giddy and playful. Mia can't help bu laugh. The roommates sing and dance, hoping to persuade M to join the night's revelry... Mia remains reluctant. Stays behind in her room as her roommates head out the door. But she's starting to wonder night at home, feeling sorry for herself -- or a night ou with her friends...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're outside now, and BACK with Tracy, Alexis and Caitli marching across the courtyard and toward the street. They sing, dance, half-assuming Mia is a no-go -- -- until Mia APPEARS, blue-dress-clad. Her roommates look her in surprise -- then delight. The energy swells and th four characters dance their way together down the street. They dive into a single CAR, and WE DISSOLVE TO... 10    OMIT. A10   OMIT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old-fashioned MONTAGE of a night on the town: neon sig and overflowing champagne glasses. Soon enough, we're at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valet cars lined up. We FOLLOW Alexis, Tracy, Caitlin and to the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and into a big-glass hilltop pad. We FOLLOW Mia as she takes in her surroundings. Revision                          8.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A D.J. turning tables. A FAT OLD PRODUCER dancing with a TWENTY-SOMETHING. A trio of AGENTS glad-handing each othe rhythm by the bar. Yep -- every clichГ© is here... Mia tries talking to a pair of WOMEN -- who promptly ditc her. Seeing she's now alone, a YOUNG MAN swoops in to hit on h She makes a hasty exit toward the bar -- but the line's obscenely long. She nears the BATHROOM door -- but a COUPLE stands in her making out. She slips in behind them... A13   Inside the BATHROOM, Mia takes a moment. The joy of ago is gone from her eyes now. She gazes into the mirror -- and SINGS by herself. This verse, sung in private, belongs to a new style: less brash, and far more vulnerable... Once finished, Mia takes a breath, steels herself to once again face the world, opens the door -- and rejoins the crowd... B13   We MOVE with her slowly now -- surrounded by the pa everything set at a snail's pace, the crazed carousers mo in SLOW MOTION. It's the sadness underneath the revelry, pain underneath the clichГ©s... Gradually we RAMP UP. Follow Mia OUTSIDE, where we see th splash of blue-green that is the POOL -- and a flurry of SNOW falling from above... As we reach FULL-SPEED, a PARTY-GOER races to the edge, j -- and we PLUNGE WITH HIM INTO THE POOL. This is the climax of the number. Everyone joins in, circling the pool -- a swath of color against the black s Everyone dances, everyone sings -- and the song concludes with a blast of fireworks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on a sign: "NO PARKING ANYTIME: TOW-AWAY ZONE". Revision                      9.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... We see Mia -- all alone, staring at the sign. No car in sight. She reaches into her purse, pulls out her cell pho to call Tracy. It's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia trudges down the steep hill in her unwieldy heels. Sh hour-and-a-half walk from her place. She crosses roads an navigates stretches where the sidewalk stops and gives wa shrubbery. A19   And then -- she hears something... Music. A piano, distance. And a MELODY -- one we will come to know very w Without being sure why, she FOLLOWS THE SOUND. Passes sev doors. Then stops. Has found where it's coming from... She reaches out -- and slowly opens a door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHT. The same 101 traffic jam we beg with. This time we're on Sebastian -- the honker. He passes Mia's car. She gives him the finger. He drives shaking his head...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian sips a coffee as he gazes across the street -- a 30's Deco building. A sign above the door: "VAN BEEK". newer sub-heading below: "TAPAS & TUNES". Revision                          10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens. Two EMPLOYEES step out, setting up a vale stand. Sebastian watches them -- and shakes his head. The employees notice him. Recognize him. What is it with that guy...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian enters his apartment -- cramped, dingy, bare walls, no furniture or decoration, boxes filled with dust black-and-white photographs and unused instruments on the floor, a black Steinway upright piano in the center of th living room -- and sees a WOMAN rummaging around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta stop breaking into my home. She looks up. She's 37 quickly going on 50, and dressed l she doesn't care. This is LAURA, Sebastian's older sister

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think Mom or Dad would call this a home? Seeing that she's seated on a stained, decrepit stool --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't sit on that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Hoagy Carmichael sat on that stool. The Baked Potato was gonna throw it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder why. (then, rising,)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I brought you this. It's a throw rug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't need it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? What if I told you Miles Davis pissed on it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's almost insulting... (then,)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he? Revision                        11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes her head: Unbelievable. Tosses the rug to the LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When are you going to unpack these boxes? SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I unpack them in my club. LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. It's like a girl broke up with you and you're stalking her. (then, looks at him --) You're not still going by there, are you? SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. A beat. Then -- SEBASTIAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've turned it into a tapas-samba place. You believe that? LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seb -- SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who wants to tapas while they samba? LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have someone I want you to meet. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to meet anyone. LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll like her. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. Does she like jazz? LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably not. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what are we gonna talk about? LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll talk about the weather. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok. Then I have someone I'd like you to meet. He's got a face tattoo, but a heart of gold. Revision                      12. LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian -- SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long's it been? LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to get serious. You live like a hermit. You're driving without insurance. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am serious. I had a very serious plan for my future. It's not my fault I got Shanghai'ed. LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did not get "Shanghai'ed", you got ripped off. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the difference? LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not as romantic as that. (she starts to walk off) And everyone knew that guy was shady except for you. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you say romantic like it's a dirty word? LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unpaid bills are not romantic. Call her. She heads to the door. He follows her, won't give it up - SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're acting like life's got me on the ropes -- what you don't understand is, I want to be on the ropes. I'm letting life hit me `til it gets tired. Then I'm gonna make my move. It's a classic rope-a-dope. Laura can't help but laugh. Stops by the door. Looks at h LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you. Unpack your boxes. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm changing the locks. Revision                       13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (out the door with a smile --)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't afford it. She's gone. Sebastian thinks for a beat, then calls out -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a phoenix rising from the ashes! No reply to his triumphant declaration. He shuts the door Looks again at the napkin. Thinks. Tosses it in the trash

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moments later. Sebastian takes a slice of pizza from the fridge, pours himself some more coffee, places a Thelonio Monk LP onto a record player, and sits down at the piano. "Japanese Folk Song" -- the piece we heard in his car -- plays... Sebastian plays along. Stops. Moves the record back a few bars. Starts it again. Plays the same passage over. Stops Moves the record back a second time. Plays the passage ag Stops. Over and over, just like in his car -- until, fina he gets it right. He keeps playing, louder now, and we're --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A red-booth bar-and-restaurant. Christmas decorations all Sebastian steps in. Immediately beelining over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (putting on a smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill. Thanks for having me back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your welcome. Stick to the set list. Revision                       14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. (under his breath as he heads to the piano)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Though I don't think they care what I play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do, and I don't want to hear the free jazz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How `bout one for you, one for me? Or two for you, one for me? (the Boss just glares)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or all for you, none for me? Ok, that works. Good deal. Sebastian sits down at the keys. A WAITRESS passes by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... Welcome back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a nice way to say that. With that -- he starts playing "Jingle Bells".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The restaurant's demographic has changed. It's now younge stragglers wandering in. Sebastian looks beyond bored. He finishes "We Wish You a Merry Christmas". Zero applause. He begins a new chart: "Deck the Halls". But something se to come over him now. He's restless. Slowly, his playing drifts off -- his fingers charting their own path... And then -- we hear a melody. The one Mia heard outside. one we'll refer to from now on as Mia and Sebastian's son The door opens -- and Mia steps in. She sees Sebastian at piano. Is instantly struck by his playing. [MIA AND

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN'S THEME
dialogues.text: Gradually -- all sounds but the music drop out. We drift from reality. Even the walls seem to go slightly darker - though Sebastian and Mia were all alone... He concludes h piece with a jumble of chords, his playing almost free ja now, as we pull back to real life... ...and see the Boss looking on in scorn. Revision                        15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian finishes. Silence. Mia looks like the wind has knocked out of her. Sebastian looks up for a second -- an sees her. They look at one another. Just a moment. Then -- the Boss taps Sebastian on the shoulder. WE STAY Mia as she watches Sebastian rise with the Boss. We just the Boss talking to Sebastian, can't hear what is said. T we get closer -- and realize: BOSS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...every goddamned night. Sebastian is silent. Then, doesn't want to have to beg bu SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll stick to the set list, I promise -- BOSS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late. You're done. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not gonna find a better player. You know that. BOSS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leans in, and --) Do you think anyone here gives a shit? With that, the Boss walks off. We linger on Sebastian. An giving way -- to hurt. He starts hurrying toward the door BACK TO Mia -- who didn't hear what was said. She watches Sebastian -- takes a breath, so moved that she's about to it all out -- swoops in to corner him -- and -- MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to say -- I saw your playing, and I -- -- but Sebastian just walks right by -- his shoulder bumping against Mia's for an added measure of disdain. He heads out the door. Slams it shut. Mia is left standin her own. She looks like she's just been slapped. SMASH CUT TO BLACK. Revision                         16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia auditions. Pilot season cattle-call -- a series of so crushing try-outs. She's pandering to the hilt. Quick gli

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like the fissure on the GT scan. Did you test for achromatopsia? 31   Then, a second audition --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D.O.A. on 23rd, perp laughing his face off at P.D. Damn Miranda Rights. 32   And finally, a third audition --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my classroom. You don't like it, the door's to my left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a well-dressed forty-year-old WOMAN reading from sides)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lady why you be trippin' like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Jamal. You be trippin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia wanders around another party. A BAD 80's COVER BAND p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you are! You need to meet someone! Carlo, this is Mia. Mia, Carlo's a writer.

dialogues.speaker: CARLO TRACY
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you, Mia.          He's got projects all ove town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs, faux-modest)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say I have a knack for world-building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes this in; then --)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations. I have to grab a drink... Revision                        17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slips away. Presses toward the bar. The music gets lo more obnoxious. She peers toward the band to get a look.. And then she sees him. Sebastian. Playing keyboard-guitar for the band. Dressed up like his mates in a bright polyester outfit. And hating every seco The band finishes, and the SINGER addresses the (thin) cr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, one more for y'all before we break. Do I hear any requests?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I Ran". Sebastian turns. Sees Mia, looking at him with a defiant enjoying her power. He thinks -- then recognizes the face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I Ran" it is. (to Sebastian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna start us off, piano-man? Sebastian stays silent. Mortified. Finally, so reluctant, taps his keyboard to count the band in and begins playing On the keys, it's a single note, repeated measure after m Mia knew this. Sebastian looks at her. She smiles right b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I walked along the avenue...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Set break. Sebastian hurries from the keys -- enters the looks both ways, finally spots Mia and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok. I remember you. Mia looks at him. One eyebrow raised. Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm sorry if I was curt that night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Curt"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok I was an asshole. I can admit that. Revision                       18. MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But requesting "I Ran" from a serious musician -- it's too far. MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God. Did you just call yourself "a serious musician"? SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) I don't think so. MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I borrow what you're wearing? SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I have an audition next week. I'm playing a serious fire-fighter. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irritation building --) So you're an actress. That makes sense. Have I seen you in anything? MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... The coffee shop on the Warner Brothers lot. That's a classic. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you're a barista. Well now I see how you can look down on me from all the way up there. SINGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (popping in from nowhere) Sebastian. Second set. Sebastian looks at Mia. She smirks. Pleased. The Singer w off. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't tell me what to do. MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just told you what to do. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I let him. Revision                          19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia. Guess I'll see you in the movies. He heads back to the keys, and the band resumes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never seen you lookin' so lovely as you did tonight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party's finished. Sebastian exits, pulling out his ke as we DRIFT and see a long line to the VALET. Standing wa the back, waiting, is Mia. She's stuck once again with CA who's regaling her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Goldilocks from the point of view of the bears. Home-invasion thriller. Fox and Warners are going crazy for it. Mia spots Sebastian, passing by the Valet with his keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...We're going after Charlize. For the bear. We're flipping it. Feels like a franchise. But the thing is it's grounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sebastian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George Michael! Sebastian stops. Looks at her. Surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you just get your keys? Sebastian thinks. Sees the Valet. Playing it off --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Yeah. Revision                       20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you grab mine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Which one is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Prius. A beat. Sebastian turns to the Valet's box. Motions to th Valet: Sorry. One second. Looks. All the keys are Prius k

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one with the green ribbon. Another beat. Sebastian finds it. Grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia and Sebastian trudge up a hill lined with cars. Mia a her key fob. No beep. Sebastian points his own keys, also aiming for a beep. Silence. They've been at this for a wh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost tripping in her heels)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those look comfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are...n't. A beat. She aims again. No beep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for saving the day back there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't give me much of a choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strange that we keep running into each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is strange. Maybe it means something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I doubt it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah I don't think so either. Revision                        21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On that, Mia aims again. As always -- no beep. Noticing - SEBASTIAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put the clicker under your chin. MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Sebastian demonstrates with his fob. He looks idiotic. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It turns your head into an antenna. Probably gives you cancer, but you find your car more quickly. MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't live as long, but you get things done faster, so it all evens out. MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. Just then, they reach a clearing -- AND THE CITY SKYLINE APPEARS BELOW. A ribbon of lights, stretching as far as y can see. It's the most romantic sight imaginable. They lo at each other. A beat. And then -- MIA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eh. They walk on, the lights shimmering behind. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much to look at. MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agreed. I've seen better. And on that -- they SING. [A LOVELY NIGHT] Mia and Sebastian try to downplay the romanticism of this setting, this moment -- being lost here, at night, alone together, atop a hill, the city glittering before them. I "no big deal", nothing they haven't seen or felt before - because, after all, there's no chance for romance between them... Of course, the music, swelling and building, suggests otherwise. Mia tires of her heels, finds a bench and fish for flats in her handbag. Sebastian sits beside her as sh slips the flats on. They look at each other, suspicious.. Revision                        22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves his foot. She moves hers. They look at each othe again. Still suspicious... He moves again. She moves again. They seem to be moving i sync -- without their even wanting to... And -- bit by bit -- before our eyes -- they've almost slipped into DANCE... Sebastian rises. Mia rises as well. The two look at each other. Run back to the bench, hop atop it -- the lights stretch out like a magic carpet. They share a moment -- s a look -- jump off -- AND START REALLY DANCING NOW... Mia does a move, Sebastian responds. Sebastian does a mov shakes her head: "Nope". They make the road their own, gr more and more energized, as surprised as we are to find - ...that they can really dance together. Just as this starts to look like a blossoming romance, re joy peeking through, our two heroes getting closer and cl and closer, looking at each other almost giddily... ...a sound cuts through. It's a CELL PHONE ring. Mia and Sebastian turn -- to her handbag, back by the ben Snapped out of it, Mia heads over and pulls out her cell. MIA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... Greg...? Can you hear me...? Yeah, I'm just leaving now... K, see you soon... She hangs up. Looks at Sebastian. An awkward silence. Fin she presses her fob again. Puts it under her chin this ti BEEP can be heard. They see her Prius. MIA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. Great... Well... Do you want a ride to your car? SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's fine... Thanks... MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Ok... Not sure what else to say, she heads to her vehicle. Wave MIA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night. Sebastian waves back. Mia drives off. Fast. Silence... Revision                        23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking even more disappointed than he thought he'd be, Sebastian walks on for a bit -- then retreats back down. A37   Comes to a stop across from the party, and we see h right, it seems, where he knew it was all along. He pulls his keys -- they don't have a clicker after all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are these pastries gluten-free? Mia's at work. A typically chaotic day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?? I want a refund. Mia nods, heads to the Manager --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're closing up Friday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have an audition. Remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I look like I care? Reschedule it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you said --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And fix your apron. With that, the Manager walks off. Mia is silent for a mom -- wants to talk back but needs this job -- then turns -- sees Sebastian at the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Hi. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meetings. Studio heads. Revision                       24.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. How'd you get on the lot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piece of cake. Mia looks at him. He's sweating through his shirt. A beat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually it took me four hours and I ended up running. We probably have twenty minutes before the guy finds me. You got a break coming up? Mia laughs. A moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm off in ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. I'll hide in the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia exits, apron off. She and Sebastian start walking. Sh across the street -- to the faГ§ade of a Parisian apartme

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the window Ingrid Bergman and Humphrey Bogart looked out of in Casablanca. Sebastian nods. They start walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your Bogart's name...? (Mia looks at him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it Greg?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Greg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been seeing each other for a few months. An awkward beat. They pass a wooden SALOON -- where a WES is being shot. Extras in COWBOY costumes drink coffee on steps. Revision                        25. MIA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love this stuff. Makes coming to work easier. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you mean. I get breakfast five miles out of the way just to sit outside a jazz club. MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was called Van Beek. The swing bands played there. Count Basie. Chick Webb. (then,) It's a samba-tapas place now. MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A what? SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samba-tapas. It's... Exactly. The joke's on history. Mia laughs. SEBASTIAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, that's L.A. They worship everything and they value nothing. They reach a patch of green. Another shoot. A P.A. yells P.A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear the frame! MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sebastian) We need to wait here. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. They shoot movies on my street. "C-stands." "Apple box." "Don't forget to sign out." Mia laughs. A beat. A.D. (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet on set! Mia and Sebastian watch the cameras roll. Then, in a whis SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you get into all this? Revision                          26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Into...? Oh -- I -- my aunt was an actress. She was in this traveling theater company... And there was this little library across the street from my house when I was growing up. This was Boulder City, Nevada -- every house looked exactly the same. I was ten and already I needed to get out. And one day, my aunt flew into town, and she showed me the library's old-movie section. We spent a whole day watching one after the other. Bringing Up Baby. Notorious. Casablanca. (a beat; then,)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never knew the world was so big.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut! Mia and Sebastian resume walking. Now, at full volume --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I started putting on plays in my garage. I'd write the scripts and print up programs, and she'd give me props to use from wherever she'd just been -- New York, London, Paris. And then she'd jet off again and I wouldn't hear from her for another year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who would you invite to watch? Your parents?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God no -- I didn't invite anyone. That would have been terrifying. C40   CUT TO: The entrance to a giant soundstage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honestly, I wish I loved something else. I've tried so hard to want other things. She and Sebastian stop. Peer inside the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I left school after two years to come here, my fourth manager just dropped me, and my last audition was for a teen soap pitched as Dangerous Minds meets The O.C. (a beat; then, deadpan --)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should've been a lawyer. Revision                        27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They resume walking. D40   CUT TO: A row of closed soundstages, sandy-tan agai bright blue sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...`Cause the world needs more lawyers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it doesn't need more actresses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not just an actress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, "just an actress"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said it yourself, you're a child- prodigy playwright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is not what I said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're too modest to say it but it's true. So you could write your own roles. Write something that's as interesting as you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last thing I wrote was a stand-up routine for an open-mic night. It was horrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I'm saying is -- Louis Armstrong could have played the marching-band charts he was given. What did he do instead? He made history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, I'll stop auditioning and make history instead. Sebastian laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway -- I'm getting a feeling there's something I should tell you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Revision                       28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate jazz. Sebastian stops. Turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean? "I hate jazz"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means when I listen to it I don't like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's such a blanket statement. It's like saying "I hate animals".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do hate some animals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you need to be anywhere right now? Mia looks at him. We hear DRUMS. A swinging ride pattern. we're in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- an old-school JAZZ CLUB. It's almost empty, only aged CATS here -- except for Mia and Sebastian, watching a QUA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most people say they hate jazz because they don't have context. They don't get where it came from. All these people packed into flophouses in New Orleans, speaking five different languages, and jazz was how they talked to each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it was just Kenny G.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...What? Mia looks at him. Already knows just how to get to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I associate it with facials. It's relaxing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not relaxing! Sid Bechet got into a gunfight `cause somebody told him he played a wrong note! Revision                           29. MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laying it on thick) Right, but it's good to talk over. Where I grew up there's this jazz station they'd play at cocktail parties whenever they served the salami and cheese. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia. These are things you can't unsay. She bursts into laughter. Sebastian points to the band -- SEBASTIAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not cocktail music -- it's a high- wire act. These guys are performing and composing and rearranging all at once. A beat. Mia looks at the band. We DRIFT over the instrume SEBASTIAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why you need to be in the space and see what's at stake. This whole thing -- it's dying. In twenty minutes they'll head off to cut commercial sessions or do pit at the Pantages `cause they have to -- but when I have my own place -- my club -- they'll play whatever they want. Mia looks at Sebastian. Her laughter has subsided. She ca see something in him now -- the same passion he's speakin MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your club? SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...It's gonna be the old Van Beek. I'm getting the lease back. It'll be perfect. He watches the band. Lost in the sound. Then -- sincere - SEBASTIAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world tells everyone to move on. Says the music's had its moment. But I love it too much. I'm not moving on. The band finishes. The ride cymbal sizzles in the air... SEBASTIAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So? He looks at Mia. She's visibly moved. Just then -- we hear a BEEP. Mia looks at her phone. Revision                      30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, I just missed a call...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia steps out, dazed. Sebastian's listening to a new tune spots Mia, turns to her -- as, shouting over the music --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a call-back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That show I told you about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dangerous Minds meets The O.C.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. It's -- actually more like Rebel Without a Cause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's amazing! "I got the bulletsssss!" Mia laughs. But Sebastian can tell something in her laugh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've seen it, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obviously. (a beat; then --)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? You're the movie person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the one I lie about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. You can't do this audition and never see Rebel. The theater near me's playing it. If you want -- I can take you. For research.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (considering this)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Ok. Revision                          31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10pm Monday at the Rialto. Cool?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok. (another nod, taking it in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For research. Mia looks at him -- he looks at her -- each of them suppressing a newfound giddiness... And on that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia and Sebastian exit. Wave "good-bye". We FOLLOW Sebast He rounds the corner, nears the Hermosa Beach pier... ...and begins to SING. [CITY OF STARS] Lifted by a strang new feeling -- a feeling he wasn't expecting. The feeling that perhaps -- just perhaps -- he's falling in love... He gazes out at the sea, the purple sky. Dances with an O COUPLE, then continues on his way, as though caught in a dream. There's an uncertainty in his singing -- he's not if this dream will sustain. But for now, it's a beautiful feeling... The MUSIC simmers down -- and WE FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Pasadena building. As Mia approaches the door, another ring. It's her MOM. This time, Mia is happy to get the ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Mom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, sweetie. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, actually: I got a call-back on a pilot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God! You're going to be on TV??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well -- it's not picked up yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not picked up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First they make the pilot, then if they like the pilot it goes on TV. Revision                           32.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're in the pilot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, no, I have a call-back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see... Didn't you audition for a TV thing last week?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's another audition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see... So you might get a role in a thing that might one day be put on TV...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Well when you put it like that it sounds like a huge accomplishment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't mean that, it's so exciting. What channel? ABC? HBO?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oxygen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oxygen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what, I have to go. I love you. She hangs up. Takes a deep breath. Enters the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia sits, starts reviewing her script. Looks around her -- the room is filled with ACTRESSES sil MOUTHING THEIR LINES. It's a bizarre sight: a dozen women moving their mouths, with no sound coming out at all. What's more, they're all in variations of the same type o costume: Michelle Pfeiffer's leather jacket from Dangerou Minds. A few stare at Mia, sizing her up. In the corner, another one of them GRUNTS while performing stretches. Then -- a DOOR to the side opens, and Mia can hear --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...We'll be seeing you very soon. Revision                        33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ACTRESS exits. Absolutely beaming. And then, a bored v

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia Dolan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia steps in. The pilot's DIRECTOR is seated at a table, looking in his folder at Mia's head-shot. He looks up at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whenever you're ready. Mia breathes in. Heart pounding. Sweat percolating. Has b practicing this for days now. Fighting her nerves, she begins --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two options. Follow my rules, or follow my rules. Kapish? You want to bully, you'd best be ready to get bullied --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Mia is taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can do it another way --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thanks, that was great. We linger on Mia for a moment, and then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crestfallen, humiliated, Mia hurries to her car. Sees a v mail on her cell. Plays it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad just helped me find Oxygen on the guide! So exciting! So will you be getting health insurance now? Mia switches her phone off and drives. Clenches her jaw. Turns left and sees a movie theater. The Rialto. Manages smile. Something she can remain upbeat about... Revision                        34.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia in her room, sorting through outfits. Slips into jean

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia? -- then spins around, startled. Alexis is at the door, ea Fritos. Has been crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with difficulty)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg's here... Mia looks at Alexis -- completely confused. Then -- Greg out behind Alexis. Waves to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... I'm parked out front. But we should hurry, my brother just landed. Mia looks at him, still confused. Then remembers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you forget?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. No. Yes. I'll change...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's ok. Mia closes her door -- turns -- and we see her face. She' crushed. She goes to call Sebastian -- then freezes. Remembers something else. She never got his number... We linger on her face, as, on his phone outside her door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh! Yep, just picking Mia up now. Will be there in twenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian's playing a jam session. Excited, distracted. 1 can't come quickly enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia, in a green dress, with Greg, his brother JOSH, and Josh's FIANCEE. The restaurant is posh, modern. Josh wear Brooks Brothers suit: he seems better-off than his brothe Revision                      35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right -- but now we've got a surround-sound set-up, so it's like --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like being in a movie theater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's better than going to a theater, really. You know theaters these days --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sure --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- they're so dirty, and they're either too hot or too cold, and there's always people talking, which is just -- (his phone buzzes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- just so annoying, I mean you're trying to watch a movie -- one second -- (opens phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?... His FiancГ©e smiles, looks at Greg and Mia, proud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'll have to call you back. (closes and pockets his phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, yeah, we love it. Awkward silence. Mia hasn't spoken a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian paces. People shuffle in. He looks. No sign of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Midway through the meal. Mia is bored, restless, uneasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One word for you. Nicaragua.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never heard anyone say that. Was it amazing? Revision                          36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. A five-star jungle eco-resort. It was unbelievable. Mia stays quiet, in her own thoughts, the voices around h fading away. And then she hears it -- coming from the restaurant speakers, peeking out subtly at first: the mel we now know so well... Her and Sebastian's song. She FREEZES. The radio music seems to have morphed into t melody, and the tune stirs something deep within her... A few seconds pass. And then she can't deny it any longer It's clear as day to her now. She rises from her seat --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia? -- looks at Greg --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. -- and -- as the sounds of a FULL ORCHESTRA swoop in -- -- RUNS out of the restaurant as fast as she can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MUSIC SWELLS, strings carrying us through and lifting Mia's spirits as she runs down the street in her green dr for once absolutely sure of what she's doing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the Rialto, Sebastian settling into his seat, the about to begin. He's visibly disappointed that he's alone lights dim. Projector light cuts through the darkness. An then, as the movie's credits start up, Sebastian spots, o the corner of his eye, a figure in the aisle... He looks. The figure turns. Looks at him. It's Mia. And, caught like a freeze-frame in the projector   light, green dress incandescent, the giant movie screen   behind like a great piece of back-projection, she looks   more b than ever right now. A true old-fashioned screen   siren. Sebastian's eyes go wide. He's surprised. And thrilled. H waves. Mia hurries toward him. Takes the seat next to his as Rebel Without a Cause begins... Revision                           37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half an hour has passed. The movie plays, lights flickeri on Mia and Sebastian's darkened faces. He puts his arm on the armrest, she moves hers nervously. He scoots to his right, she scoots back. She edges her elbow onto the armrest, he moves his arm. Inch by inch, their bodies grow closer. Hands approaching breaths quickening, hearts pounding... ...until finally their hands touch... And then, suddenly -- just as James Dean and Natalie Wood arrive at Griffith Observatory, and Mia and Sebastian see about to kiss -- -- burn marks streak their way across the image. The screen goes blank. Silence. The lights go on. Mia and Sebastian turn around. AUDIENCE MEMBERS start murmuring. Sebastian can barely believe his bad luck. But then Mia turns to him. Energized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian's car, traveling up a winding road, stars glitt above it, the lights of Los Angeles glittering below it. is a deep, painted blue. Music plays... [PLANETARIUM] The car is bending around the turns, making its way up to A57   ...the real Griffith Observatory. There, our MUSIC Our two characters get out of the car and wander, searchi for an open entrance. They find one -- and sneak in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They ascend a staircase. Make their way past the exhibits the Tesla coil shooting off electric bolts. They reach the pendulum, gaze up at the mural above it, l one another. Circle the pendulum, and then -- so tenderly nervously... Revision                          38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...they begin to DANCE. This is a dance that fulfills all the promise in their earlier duet. They circle the floor, gently and gracefull The music BUILDS, and they drift into... A58   ...the PLANETARIUM. It's darkened, empty. Mia remov shoes, feels the soft carpet under her feet. Turns on the projector. The screen STARTS TO GLOW. She and Sebastian t in the sight -- the STARS and GALAXIES... Enchanted, they look at one another, the lights from the screen reflected on their faces. They approach, as though about to kiss... When -- -- Mia's shoes LIFT UP. Float toward the ceiling -- towar star-filled screen. She and Sebastian trade looks. Realiz And then they too begin to FLOAT... ...RISING from the floor, nothing stopping them. SOARING past the views of comets and moons and nebulae. Eyes wide their emotions seized, as they HOLD EACH OTHER TIGHT... And so unspools a gravity-free dance. Mia and Sebastian SPIN and TWIRL through the planetarium though they themselves were in outer space, flying throug the cosmos. The music carries them higher and higher, and their spirits likewise soar -- JOYOUS, EXUBERANT -- until finally... ...the music SOFTENS. Mia and Sebastian drift back to the floor like feathers. land on a pair of seats. There, once again seated like audience members at a movie turn and look into each other's eyes. The music picks bac for the big finish, as the lovers lean in and -- in true movie old-Hollywood big-musical fashion -- -- LOCK LIPS. It's their first kiss, and it's a kiss to remember -- ful all the hope and yearning and terror and wonder of love's blush. A swoon-worthy kiss, with the orchestra soaring an camera swooping in to catch the embrace in all its glory. On this triumphant moment... ...we IRIS FADE OUT. Revision                      39.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia's scribbling in a notebook. It's dialogue. We see cha headings, scene headings. Seems to be some kind of a scri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that? Mia turns. Tracy has wandered in -- pajamas, eating cerea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a script?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a play. I'm going to put it on myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chiming in from her bedroom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A play? You better give us roles!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually -- it's a -- it's a one-woman show... A beat -- and then -- AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHT. HONKING outside the nearest window. It's a honk we recogn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Is that gonna happen every time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glowing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia dashes out -- and LEAPS into Sebastian's car and into arms. They KISS -- giddy, emotional, as though they'd bee separated for years. Sebastian drives off -- when --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's one-way!! The car SCREECHES to a stop in front of a TRUCK going the opposite direction. Sebastian goes into REVERSE as Mia cr up laughing. A BURST OF MUSIC as a title card pops on: Revision                          40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MUSIC carries us through the following series of GLIM 62    -- Mia and Sebastian ambling past weathered 30's bu BUNKER HILL... 63    -- Mia guiding Sebastian down a street peppered wit ERA HOMES, past old gas-lamps and palms... 65    -- VAN BEEK. Sebastian gestures to the "TAPAS & Excitedly tries to deface it. Mia, aghast, pulls him back 66    -- The HUNTINGTON GARDENS, where Mia and Sebastian the tiny forest... A66   -- WATTS TOWERS, where the two lovers stroll and ki

dialogues.speaker: OMIT
dialogues.text: 64    -- The GRAND CENTRAL MARKET, where they grab food.. 68    -- ANGEL'S FLIGHT at night, where they stumble and a tipsy, love-soaked dance...

dialogues.speaker: OMIT
dialogues.text: Interspersed throughout, WE SEE IMAGES OF LOS ANGELES: 1940's high-rises, green movie-movie lettering, ochre wal shaded by palm fronds, red flowers and Spanish missions, lamps and Art Deco hotels. It's a gorgeous city, and the only makes it more gorgeous -- building and carrying us t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Lighthouse JAM SESSION. Sebastian's at the keys, having blast. The place is again mostly empty, but Mia is dancin heart out. She shoots looks at Sebastian. He laughs, play for her. The two of them are in their own world -- one of unadulterated JOY... The song ends. Sebastian rises, joins Mia. They sit down the band strikes up a new tune, and kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian? Mia and Sebastian look up, startled. A YOUNG MAN, 35, is standing next to them. Tall, fierce eyes. This is KEITH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keith? Revision                       41. KEITH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit. Come here, man. Sebastian gets up. Gives him a hug. But Mia can sense an unease in Sebastian's eyes. It's a strained hug. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Mia. Mia, Keith. (explaining to Mia)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We used to play together.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH MIA
dialogues.text: Hey, Mia.                         Hey... Sebastian sits back down. Wants to end the conversation. KEITH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how've you been? SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. You? KEITH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keeping busy. Got a new combo. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good for you. KEITH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Looking for keys. SEBASTIAN (after a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm good. KEITH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure? It pays. Sebastian looks at Keith. A moment. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm good. Keith almost smiles. Expected this. KEITH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just grab a drink then. Call me. It's been too long. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet. KEITH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice meeting you, Mia. Revision                           42.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice meeting you. Keith walks off. Mia and Sebastian look at each other. Th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON MIA. She looks anxious. CLOSE ON Sebastian. He l head-over-heels in love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...You're just saying that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I'm not. We PULL BACK -- and see a script on Mia's lap. She's just finished reading Sebastian her play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... Is the whole thing too nostalgic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But do you think people will like it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck `em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You always say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I truly believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine -- as long as you sit front-row `cause I'll probably throw up on the middle of the stage otherwise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be front-row. Mia looks at him. Smiles. It genuinely means the world to her. Then, a glow in her eyes, wants to reciprocate -- Revision                       43. MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made something for you. She hops off the bed, fishes through a bag. Pulls out a drawing. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that? MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could be the name design. On the door. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why does it say "Seb's"? MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you should name it. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never. MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian, no one's going to a club called "Chicken on a Stick". SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't get it. Charlie Parker got the name "Bird" because he loved chicken. So my club's gonna be old-school jazz and beer and chicken. "Chicken on a Stick". MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Drop the chicken. Drinks and jazz. (he rolls his eyes) And it's time to start looking for other places. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gotta be Van Beek. I can't let them samba all over its history. MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make your own history. Sebastian looks at her. Appreciates that line. A beat. Th SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your play's incredible. Mia smiles. He approaches her, sits by her side. SEBASTIAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole world from your bedroom? Who's doing that? Revision                    44. MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm doing that. They laugh. MIA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So who was that guy at the Lighthouse? SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Which guy? MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one who offered you a gig. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean Keith? He's the worst. MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why was it weird between you two? SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's always weird with him. MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did offer you a job. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right... MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to call him? SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. A beat. MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok... A moment passes. They lie down, side by side. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's what we know. It's definitely Chicken on a Stick -- (Mia rolls her eyes) -- and your play is going to be a triumph. She looks at him. He looks at her. A shared smile. And on that -- Revision                       45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The next morning. Sebastian is in bed. Hears snatches of voice -- she's on her phone in the other room:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...No, Mom, it's a one-woman show... No, I'm acting in it as well... No, I'm not getting paid, I'm paying to do it... (then,)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's great... He's going to open his own jazz club. It's going to be incredible... (beat; then, softer --)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well he has to get the money together first, and... He's figuring it out... Yeah, it's just been a little tricky lately... Sebastian listens. Takes it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look -- he's going to find a way to open it and you're going to love it. Ok? How's Dad? On Sebastian. He thinks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian enters. Keith's combo is assembled. It's a sign-up practice room in the West Valley. There's drummer, electric bassist, and trumpeter: COLE, MALCOLM a TOM. They're more polished in their looks than Sebastian. Well-groomed beards, tighter jeans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian. Sebastian approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't know if I'd see you today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a bit awkward)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... Here I am. A moment. Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the piano? Keith gestures -- to an electronic keyboard. Sebastian wi Revision                     46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the deal. We've got distribution with Universal, got our own imprint. We're about to go on the road. We can cut you in for 1K a week while we tour, plus an equal share of any merchandise or ticket revenue that comes in. Sound good? We see Sebastian's face. Taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that...that... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...sounds good. A moment. Keith smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's play, see how it feels. He pulls out a guitar. Cole starts on drums. Keith joins Malcolm and Tom follow suit. Sebastian listens. It sounds modern jazz -- electronic in feel, but still jazz... Sebastian approaches the keyboard. Joins -- slowly, one s at a time. Then begins playing out a bit more, his finger starting to race. Malcolm gives Keith a look: "Damn". Kei gives Malcolm a look back: "I told you so." Bit by bit, Sebastian eases into the groove. This isn't so bad... Then -- Keith moves to a LAPTOP. Introduces a DRUM-MACHIN SAMPLE. Sebastian, into the music, is caught off-guard. Uneasy no This isn't him... Keith plays a riff on his guitar. Tom echoes it on bass, Malcolm on trumpet. Now it's Sebastian's turn. He hesitat And then -- finally -- he plays the riff... It doesn't feel so bad. The guys build on the riff. Sebas keeps up with them, trying to let go of his presuppositio After all -- these guys can play... The music builds, the whole thing swelling and finally

dialogues.speaker: CARRYING US TO --
dialogues.text: A73   LATER: Sebastian and Keith sit across from each oth the other players pack up. Sebastian looks pensive. Notic Revision                          47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. It's different. Sebastian stays silent. Then, leaning in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you say you want to save jazz. How are you going to save jazz if no one's listening? Jazz wouldn't exist if people hadn't gotten tired of what they were listening to before. (then,)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, do you really think a bunch of ninety-year-olds in a basement is the future of the form? Traditionalists whined when Kenny Clarke started dropping bombs. If traditionalists had their way, we'd still be playing Dixieland. Sebastian considers this. As much as he might make a play resisting -- we can tell the words are getting to him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're holding onto the past. But jazz is about the future. A moment. Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get it. I got it wrong. Last guy wasn't as good as you. But you're a pain in the ass, man. Sebastian nods. Knows he can't argue with that. Another beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's not your thing, just let me know. I don't want you uncomfortable and trying to change this into something it's not. But if you want it -- the job's yours. Sebastian looks at Keith. A moment. He's really weighing this. And on that -- his look of uncertainty -- we're --

dialogues.speaker: OMIT
dialogues.text: Revision                      48.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 77pt   INT. SEBASTIAN'S APARTMENT - DUSK The door opens. Mia enters. Takes a deep breath. Hears pi Steps forward and sees Sebastian at his piano -- playing melody we've heard before. [CITY OF STARS AS DUET] She smiles. Sebastian begins to SING. Mia sits down besid him and begins to SING as well. They share a duet -- simp unaffected, hopeful -- the music just perhaps suggesting their uncertainty about what they might be about to do... As the vocals give way to instrumentation, we're --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian and Keith hunched over paperwork. Sebastian sig

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia handing the Manager her apron. She's done with the jo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The band rehearsing in their new PRACTICE SPACE. We see Sebastian play, see Keith sing this time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia hunched over her script, obsessively fine-tuning it..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian gets dressed up in a new suit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow Mia through a BLACK-BOX THEATER in North Hollyw The space is small, simple -- but perfect. We see her hag with the OWNER -- and then light up. They shake hands...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian and the band in a green room, waiting. Sebastia wearing the new suit. Looking sharper... Revision                          49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia looking for PROPS. Another wild assortment -- a TOP H a CANE, a DIORAMA of London, rolled-up MAPS, an old GLOBE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We MOVE IN on a laptop. On it a YOUTUBE video plays -- an interview with Sebastian, Keith and the rest of the band.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia drives by the Rialto theater. It's now CLOSED...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia sits on the floor, penciling out drawings for her pla Costume and poster sketches scattered by her feet. She's tired. The clock on the wall reads: 10:54pm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia gets into bed. Checks her phone. Turns off the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian enters the apartment. Checks his reflection in mirror -- a new addition. The clock reads: 4:57am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian gets into bed, careful not to wake Mia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia crosses through to the kitchen to get herself breakfa careful not to wake Sebastian. The clock: 7:02am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian in bed, fast asleep. And WE RETURN TO...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Mia and Sebastian at the piano, before this latest jou began, finishing their song. The last lyrics resonating a they look into one another's eyes:

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN MIA
dialogues.text: City of stars...              You've never shined so brightly. Revision                           50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On that -- this image of love, Sebastian playing out the final chords on his piano -- WE GO DARK. All sound fades out. And then, we hear -- -- a CROWD CHEERING. [START A FIRE] We see -- a white spotlight. It reveals Sebastian. We're

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian is on-stage. He's the only musician we can see. floor beyond the stage is FILLED with people. Among them, we spot Mia -- beaming with pride. Sebastian her, smiles to her as he plays a piano intro. Mia grins r back, heart swelling... A SECOND SPOTLIGHT turns on, illuminating Keith. He SINGS has a beautiful voice. Mia bobs her head. It's just Keith Sebastian right now, all acoustic, a simple, catchy tune. And then -- suddenly -- a DRUM MACHINE SURGES IN -- and - BOOM! The entire CLUB is lit up as the MUSIC EXPLODES. A fledged dance beat and a thick radio-ready electronic tra Mia is taken aback. But she keeps bobbing her head -- as crowd around her GOES CRAZY... Keith owns the stage, as Sebastian plays out more -- now switched to an electronic keyboard, complete with synth sounds. We recognize fragments of melody from when Keith Sebastian first rehearsed -- but the tune has been transformed beyond recognition. Not a hint of jazz... Keith breaks into the CHORUS -- and a TRIO OF BACKUP SING are revealed stage-left. The band surges into the song's bridge -- and BACKUP DANCERS appear stage-right, scantily clad. And then -- the lights go NUTS. It's a full-out LIGHT SHO now, shafts of red, blue, green and orange cutting throug the dark. The crowd starts CHEERING, pumping their fists. Mia looks at Sebastian. He's not fighting any of this. He sees her. She smiles. But something is changing in her expression... She looks at the lights, the singers, the dancers, Sebast and his bandmates in matching magazine-cover-ready outfit She looks at the crowd around her -- their hollers growin more and more frenzied as Sebastian launches into a prolo SOLO... Revision                          51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia looks back at him, takes it all in: Is this really hi As the mass of people swells and moves, Mia finds herself PUSHED TO THE SIDE, bit by bit, away from the center... She tries to hold her ground, but is edged FURTHER AND FURTHER AWAY. Sebastian, deep in his solo, doesn't notice Mia tugs against the tide of the crowd, but to no avail. She's pushed to the back of the club, away from the light and into shadow... The final chorus begins -- floor-shaking, fist-pounding. linger on Mia's face -- watching as the band feverishly t into their climactic bars, the dancers on-stage and the c below busting out one last burst of CRAZED CHOREOGRAPHY - ending the song just as we SMASH CUT TO A TITLE CARD OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. We take a moment to collect ourselves before --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on Mia. She looks tired. A bit weathered. She's nur green tea across from Laura. They've finished eating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at him -- watch -- Mia glances out the window. A MAN in his early 40's has j parked, is walking around his car, inspecting it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now he's going to check the other window. Yep, it's closed. Now he's going to check again. Yep, still closed. Mia smiles. The MAN enters the restaurant -- greets Mia - kisses Laura. This is HARRY. Her new boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
