dialogues.text: Hey. I'm grabbing some pastries, you two want anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks Harry, I'm good. Revision                       52. LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same here but I think someone's trying to break into your car. Harry rolls his eyes, heads to the front. Laura looks at LAURA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't stress about the play. Where's Seb now? MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think today's San Diego. I'm not sure... A moment passes. LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should come over tonight. Harry's cooking, but don't let that stop you. (Mia manages a smile; a beat) What's the matter? MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing... LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You miss him. MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess. I'm adapting. LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods; then,) I got used to being alone. Growing up it was just me and Seb. We only had each other. MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He told me. LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't looking for anybody. Then I met Harry and -- we just fit... (Mia smiles) You've changed Seb. You know that? Laura means it positively -- but Mia seems concerned... MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think he's happy? LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he happy? MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean with the band, the travel, all of it. Revision                        53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our dad never got to do what he wanted. We were always treading water, he took a job running a washer-dryer store. But every night at home he'd play his clarinet along to a Benny Goodman record. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I look at Sebastian... Playing music, getting paid for it. I'm happy for him. She notices Harry through the window, returning. Her thou drift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dreams change. A beat. She looks back at Mia. Sees her worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't overthink it. He'll be home soon. Harry rejoins the table. Hands Laura a sponge cake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you not to get me anything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, right -- I'll eat it I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- I changed my mind. They laugh. Kiss. Tender. Loving. Mia watches...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia eats, her laptop next to her meal. She takes a bite, We see her screen -- an e-mail draft, glimpses of words: woman show", "one night only", "7pm", "I would be thrille She thinks. Picks up her phone. Dials Sebastian. Waits. N answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey it's me... Not sure where you are -- maybe Boston? Or Dallas? Anyway... I haven't heard from you in a while... I miss you... (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok... Bye... She hangs up. Resumes typing. Revision                    54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia walks through the courtyard. Reaches the door. Then h something... Music -- LOUD, FAST JAZZ... She enters -- has to jostle the door handle to do so -- -- and then freezes in place. Sebastian is sashaying arou fully-decked table, lighting candles as he moves. He look up, sees her -- and grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lights up. He lifts up silver serving trays, revealin what he's cooked. Roast chicken. Pasta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And... (he hurries to the kitchen -- and holds up a big apple pie) There's twenty-five pounds of apples in it. It probably destroyed an ecosystem but it tastes good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia laughs. Can't believe it. Sebastian looks at her -- sincere now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to head back in the morning but I needed to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia's eyes seem almost on the brink of tears. Beyond move she runs into Sebastian's arms. A LONG, HEARTFELT KISS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: The record player. An old jazz track. We see Mi Sebastian seated at the table -- eating, drinking, laughi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feels so good to be home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the play going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm nervous. Revision                 55. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because... (a beat) What if people show up? SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck `em! Laughter. Then -- SEBASTIAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're nervous about what they think? MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm nervous to be up on a stage and perform in front of people. I'm terrified. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They should be so lucky to see it. (then,) It's going to be incredible. I can't wait. MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can. A smile. Beat. MIA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time do you leave in the morning? SEBASTIAN
MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugh. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. Boise. MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boise? SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) You should come. MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Boise? Revision                     56. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you could knock that off your bucket list. Mia laughs. MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wish I could. A beat. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't you? MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come to Boise? SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I have to rehearse. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you rehearse anywhere? She looks at him. MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean anywhere you are? SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I -- I guess... MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, all my stuff is here and my show's in a few weeks and -- I don't know, it doesn't seem practical... SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right... I just -- we're going to have to do things so we can see each other. We never see each other. MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but when are you done? SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...What do you mean? MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When are you done with the tour? Revision                   57. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But -- as soon as we're done with the tour we go back and record, and then we go back on tour. Mia looks at him. Doesn't seem to understand. SEBASTIAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We tour so we can make the record, and then we go back on tour to sell the record. Beat. Mia takes this in. MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it's...the long haul? SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...What does that mean? MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean the long haul -- like, you're going to be in this band for a long time. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you think I was going to do? MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, I didn't think the band would -- SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't think we'd be successful. MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's not what I meant. What I meant was -- this band -- you're going to be on the road for -- what, years now? SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, feasibly -- I could be on the road for years with just this record. Beat. MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like the music you're playing? SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how that matters. MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It matters if you're going to give up your dream to be on the road for years. Revision                    58.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Do you like the music I'm playing?

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: Yes. I do. (beat) I just didn't think you did.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I --

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: And now I hear you're going to be on the road for years, and I'm --

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Why are you doing this?

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: What do you mean why am I doing this?

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: This is what you wanted from me.

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: To be in this band?

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: To have a steady job.

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: Yes, I wanted you to have a job so you could take care of yourself and start your club.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: So I'm doing that. So why aren't we celebrating?

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: Why aren't you starting your club?

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: You said yourself no one wants to go to that club! No one wants to go to a club called Chicken on a Stick --

dialogues.speaker: MIA
dialogues.text: Change the name!

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: -- and no one likes jazz. Not even you. Revision                         59. MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do like jazz now, because of you. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not listening to her) What am I supposed to do? Go back to playing "Jingle Bells" so I can save money for some Shangri-La club no one wants to go to? MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People will want to go to it! People love what other people are passionate about. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not in my experience. A beat. Mia realizes she's getting nowhere. A moment of quiet. Then -- SEBASTIAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway -- it's time to grow up. You know? This is what I'm doing. If you had a problem, I wish you would've said something earlier, before I signed on the dotted line. MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying again) You had a dream that you were sticking to, that -- SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the dream! MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not your dream. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys like me go their whole lives and never do anything that's liked. I'm finally doing something that people enjoy. What is wrong with that? MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you care so much about being liked
SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally bursting--) You're an actress, who are you to talk?? Silence. We suddenly realize -- Revision                        60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the LP has finished. You can hear the needle scratch against it now -- back and forth, back and forth. Sebasti looks at Mia. A moment. Finally --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you liked me more when I was a failure because it made you feel better about yourself. Mia looks back at him. Can't believe he said that. Tears starting to well in her eyes. She tries to suppress them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. They stare at each other. Then -- all of a sudden -- the FIRE ALARM blares. Sebastian turns and sees smoke billowing from the KITCHEN dish in the oven has started to burn. Sebastian rises, springs toward the kitchen -- then sees grabbing her things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait -- But she's out the door. It slams shut, as Sebastian pulls burnt apple pie from the oven. And on that -- WE SMASH CUT TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A poster, placed on the front of the theater we saw befor A title. A name below it: "MIA DOLAN." And a word: "TONIG We spot Mia, carrying a box of props. She enters the thea And we're --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The empty theater. Dark. Silent. Then -- a light turns on Mia steps in. We stay WIDE. She seems small from this vantage point, surrounded by her props and backdrops. She takes a moment. Looks at all the empty seats. Revision                       61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Takes a deep breath. Nervous. And then, nodding to hersel you can do this -- she starts setting up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLAST of music. The Messengers have just finished a rehearsal. Sebastian packs his stuff, heads toward the ex nodding to the others --

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN COLE
dialogues.text: See you tomorrow.                 See ya. -- when --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You good for tonight, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian stops. Looks at Keith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven. The photo shoot. (reading Sebastian's face, adding --) Mojo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. Sebastian is confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought that was next Thursday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We linger on Sebastian for a moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian stands out front. Checks his watch. Thinks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People are shuffling into the theater. We DRIFT BACKSTAGE Mia, now in a male suit and tie, watches behind a curtain Checks her phone. 7:04. Breathes in. Nervous, and alone.. She turns. Nods to the OWNER, off to the side. He heads t switch, and the lights GO DOWN. Revision                        62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can hear the murmurs beyond the curtain. The audience expecting. Mia tries to get her nerves under control. She do this... Sets her phone aside -- one last breath -- -- and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOUD MUSIC. It's the band's song, blaring from a speaker. They're pantomiming -- the musicians styled and ready for their close-ups. A PHOTOGRAPHER grabs shots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put a light on the drums... I need more fill in this corner... We ZERO IN on Sebastian. His hair sticks out at various angles. An artfully-undone tie hangs from his neck. He fake-plays, as Keith pretends to lay in sampled beats... Keith, Tom, Malcolm, Cole -- they all grin, as excited as kids. Sebastian looks at them -- then down at his elaborate outfit, then back up at the Photographer running around, then at his watch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bass, head up. Piano, look down at the keys. Sebastian does as told, but his thoughts are elsewhere. T Photographer moves in close, SNAPPING shots of just him -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut the music. Turn the keyboard live. Piano look up, play. The track stops. Sebastian stops as well. The CLICKS of t Photographer's camera loud now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- piano -- actually play something. Sebastian is still. Then he starts to play a single melod on the keys. We recognize it. The first notes of his and Mia's song... Revision                        63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, now bite your lip like you're concentrating on a solo. Beat. Sebastian stops. Silence. He stares ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was good. Don't stop. We PUSH IN on Sebastian...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're CLOSE on Mia. In ordinary clothes now. Behind her is a wallpapered wall, and a small window. By her side are the globe we saw in her room, and other litt trinkets: a pearl necklace, an old suitcase, a roll of maps. Outside the window, projection of a starlit Parisia night sky. Completely silent, Mia moves to a lamp, turns off. We go BLACK. Then -- the house lights go on. White, fluorescent. Thin applause can be heard. Mia manages a smile, as we finally -- that the theater is less than a quarter full. Mia takes a bow. Peers out. One seat, in the front row, h "RESERVED" sign on it. The seat is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia slips inside, holding in her hurt. Starts collecting few outfits -- then overhears two AUDIENCE MEMBERS outsid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear to God, if I have to hear one more hipster waxing nostalgic I'm gonna slit my wrists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not even good. That window thing...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ... Don't quit your day job... Revision                       64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laughter. Mia freezes. The nail in the coffin. The voices fade. She slides into a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian SPEEDING. Screeching to a stop. He's at Mia's T He dashes out and runs to the door. But it's locked. No one's in sight. Fuck. He spins around, frantic -- when Mia appears from an adja doorway, alone and carrying her box of props to her car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns. Sees him. He runs to her. WRAPS his arms aroun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and KISSES her. The kind of kiss that might once have swept her off her feet. He starts to move with her... ...starts to DANCE -- but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls away. Steps back. Sebastian looks at her. Unmoo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm -- I'm sorry I missed it -- and I'm sorry I was a dick and I -- I promise I'll make it up to you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't say the words with any anger. Just acceptance

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat; then --) ...What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm done embarrassing myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't embarrass yourself... Revision                     65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one showed up. I can't even pay back the theater. She says this as though just realizing it. Sebastian look at her. A moment passes. He doesn't know what to say now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna go home for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...This is home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not anymore. Sebastian is silent now. A tear in his eye. He clenches h jaw. Mia looks at him one more time, steps into her car, drives off. Sebastian lingers. Doesn't move. Silence. Then, music. So melancholy, just piano, as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia drives, boxes stacked in the back. A113   She gets on the 405... Heading out of the city...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia steps inside a modest house. Her MOM is by the door. her. Her DAD stands by the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia enters her old bedroom. Slides in a suitcase. Moves a of boxes from the hall. Looks around. Old photos. Old soc trophies. She sits down on the bed. Takes a breath. And, finally, we're...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura and Harry's ENGAGEMENT PARTY. We're outside, in a s dappled grove. A small gathering. Revision                       66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian plays a baby grand piano -- the source, we real of the music we've been hearing... As he watches   Laura dance with her new fiancГ© -- this has known for   so many years as a romantic cynic, now on again full of   all the youthful innocence of first love thoughts seem   to drift. The music comes to a close and. 117   LATER: Sebastian with Laura, by the orange trees...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember the McKenzies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, I didn't see them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. They kept going, "oh Sebastian's so handsome". Sebastian smiles. Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look beautiful. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope it was ok. I haven't played in a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were great (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're always great when you play. Sebastian is silent. Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now -- listen to me. I want you to save for a down payment. You understand? You need a home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna be hovering anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...You still think New York?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so. Maybe Boston. I don't know, it's exciting... Sebastian smiles again. Some calls from the distance -- Revision                     67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah I gotta -- the future in-laws... She lights up. Likes the sound of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is my...my hair...? Sebastian, without a word, pulls a strand back. Laura smi kisses him on the cheek. A quiet, tender moment. Then she hurries off. Sebastian stands there. Watches... WE FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RINGING. Sebastian is awoken. Groaning, he rolls over. Le the phone ring. It keeps going. Endless... Finally, fed u reaches for it. Answers --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, I'm trying to reach Mia Dolan. Sebastian is taken aback. He goes to hang up, saying just

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- She's not answering her cell and I was told I might find her here. Sebastian pauses. Hurt by the mere mention of Mia's name

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well...not anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok. If you do talk to her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- please tell her Jane at Amy Brandt Casting is trying to reach her. A beat. Sebastian sits up. Suddenly wide-eyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Casting"...? Revision                      68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner has just finished. Mia's Mom gives her a kiss --

dialogues.speaker: MIA'S MOM MIA
dialogues.text: Night, sweetie.                 Night, Mom. -- and heads off, as Mia and her Dad stay behind. Getting to scrape the dish --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want some more rice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm good... A moment. Mia's Dad puts a few more dishes away, then sit back down across from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fun having you back. Your mom ditches me at ten. Mia laughs. A moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You took down the swing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She made me. A smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've still got all your old tapes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God. Throw those away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never. Just then -- a loud, persistent HONK. Mia's Dad looks up, eyebrow raised. Mia turns, hearing it as well. The HONKIN is nearby -- just outside... Mia's thoughts suddenly sharpen. Ears perk up. She's hear honking before: Revision                         69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell...? Disbelief on Mia's face. It can't be. She heads to the ne window. There -- at the corner, smack-dab in front of her house -- is SEBASTIAN'S CAR. A NEIGHBOR angrily yells at him. Sebastian sees Mia. They eyes. And on that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia and Sebastian stand next to his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you come here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I have good news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy Brandt. The casting director.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know who she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was at your play. And she loved it. And she loved it so much that she wants you to come audition for a huge movie she's got. He's brimming over with excitement. But Mia just shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm -- no... That will kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Revision                    70. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're happy here? MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm happier. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why won't you come? MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't buy it. MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally letting it out, fed up --) Because it's another audition! (a beat; then --) I've been to hundreds of auditions. Do you want to know what happens? Either they interrupt me because someone ordered a sandwich, or they cut me off after two seconds, or I'm crying and they start laughing, or I'm one of a hundred lookalikes in the waiting room who never has a chance, because -- (beat) -- because -- SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because what? MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I'm probably not good enough. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you are. MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Maybe I'm not. A beat. MIA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I'm one of those people who's always wanted to do it but never had a chance. It's a pipe dream. Maybe it's like you said. Maybe I need to grow up. She hesitates. Continues -- Revision                         71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can go back to school. I can find something else that I'm supposed to do. I left school to give it a shot, and it didn't work out, and it took six years, and I don't want to do it anymore. Beat. But Sebastian isn't giving up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you want to do it anymore? Mia thinks about this one for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Because it hurts a little bit too much. Sebastian shakes his head. Nope. Won't accept this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told them you'd be there at five-thirty tomorrow. I'll swing by here before I drive back at eight. Either you'll be outside or you won't. With that, he gets back into his car. Mia is silent. Then

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you find me? Sebastian turns. Points. Matter-of-fact --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house across from the library. He drives off. Mia looks up. There, sure enough, is the LIBRARY, crouched on the corner. The library that once helped set her on her path to acting. She looks at it. Thinks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wide on the street. All is quiet. Night becomes morning.. Revision                         72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian's car pulls over. He sits there. Sips a coffee, second coffee in the holder. The time: 8:02. A moment passes. He taps the wheel. Looks at the house. T front door remains closed. No Mia. He leans back. Seems worried. Closes his eyes, breathes out. We MOVE CLOSE on He breathes in and out again... He opens his eyes. 8:10. The door's still closed. Resigne he starts his car up, BEGINS TO PULL AWAY, when -- -- BAM! A KNOCK on the opposite window. He jumps. It's Mia. She's just arrived at the car from the other si two just-bought cups of coffee and a bag of pastries in h hands. A beat. Sebastian smiles. Then OPENS the door for

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cloudy late afternoon. Mia and Sebastian slowly walk through the lot together. They pass the New York street, murals and posters of classic Hollywood, the old Art Deco ornaments and the big soundstages and backdrops. Neither a word...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia and Sebastian are seated. Waiting. The DOOR opens. An ACTRESS exits. A second later --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia gathers her nerves. Gets up. And steps in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the room is AMY BRANDT -- mid-forties. Seated behind h is the director, FRANK.

dialogues.speaker: AMY BRANDT MIA
dialogues.text: Hi, Mia.                        Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Amy, this is Frank. Glad we found you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia nods. Smiles. A moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The movie shoots in Paris. There's no script. Revision                        73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We want to build the character with you. It's a process. Three-month rehearsal, four-month shoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why don't you just tell us a story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...About...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About anything. Mia nods again. A moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whenever you're ready. Mia thinks. She takes a breath -- then goes silent again. seems she might be unsure what to do, might even be about choke the audition. We fear she may botch this completely A126   WE CUT TO THE LOBBY -- to Sebastian, hearing Mia's edge... Worried... B126   WE RETURN to the AUDITION ROOM... Brandt and Frank

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My aunt lived in Paris for a bit... She used to tell me these stories, when I was growing up, about living abroad... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember -- she told me she jumped into the Seine once... She pauses, and then continues -- in SONG. [TRACK: AUDITI Yes, this audition is different than the rest, and the sw to song signals just that. Mia's nerves fade away -- all accents and fakery of earlier auditions a distant memory. is Mia undisguised -- pure and stark and beautiful... She uses the story of her aunt jumping into the river to paint a portrait of all the dreamers in the world -- all people who are told they're nuts for pursuing their passi all the so-called "fools" who take the plunge. She sings about them and for them. This is why Mia does what she do why she simply has no choice... The song ends, and we linger on her for a moment. Then... Revision                     74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia and Sebastian sit on a bench, the Observatory perched behind them. The clouds have parted, and it's now a gorge Los Angeles afternoon, minutes before dusk. Sebastian looks at Mia. A moment passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When do you find out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They said the next couple of days... But I'm not expecting to find anything out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are. I know these things. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we? Sebastian looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Griffith Park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean -- where are we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think we can do anything. Because when you get this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I get this -- Revision                           75. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you get this -- you've got to give it everything you've got. Beat. SEBASTIAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your dream. MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do? SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to follow my own plan. Stay here. Get my own thing going. You know... A moment. Mia nods. Sebastian looks at her again. SEBASTIAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to be in Paris. Good jazz there. And you love jazz now. Mia smiles. SEBASTIAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right? MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Another moment. And then, finally -- SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we're just going to have to wait and see. Mia's eyes well up, just slightly, as she hears this. She nods. MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I'm always going to love you. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm always going to love you too. Beat. Sebastian looks up at the Observatory. SEBASTIAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this view. MIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (playfully) I've seen better. Revision                         76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agreed. They laugh. Then, almost to herself --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never been here during the day. Sebastian smiles. A moment. We CUT TO WIDE. Sebastian and Mia sit side by side. We li here, our two characters framed by the white-and-green Observatory, the rest of L.A. stretching out beyond. And then, ever so slowly... ...we FADE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A palm tree, a cloudless sky. We PULL BACK -- to reveal i all painted...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on a studio lot, looking at one of the old painted backdrops, of a palm tree and sky. A new title card: Five years later...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We TILT down to the studio's entryway. A CAR enters. A WOMAN steps out. We don't see her face. We FOLLOW her f behind. She walks elegantly, poised. The wind picks up a strand of her hair. She makes her way down side-streets w seen before, past Parisian-style faГ§ades. Then enters a COFFEE SHOP we recognize...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The eyes inside all look the WOMAN's way. She reaches the counter -- and we finally SEE HER FACE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi... Iced coffee, please. MIA looks different. Different haircut, different way of handling herself. The BARISTA hurries to get Mia's order. We recognize this the shop where Mia used to work. A man who appears to be NEW MANAGER gives Mia the coffee -- Revision                      77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, that's fine. Mia hands over a few dollar bills. Then drops another bil the tip jar. The Barista smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia exits the coffee shop...and is met by a CREW MEMBER o GOLF CART. She gets on the cart -- and is driven away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON hands on piano keys, fluttering across the ivori We PULL BACK: it's SEBASTIAN. We're in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a small jazz club. Simple, tasteful, cool. Stone arche 1940's style. The seats close to the band, the piano in t center. The club has the same old-school character as the Lighthouse -- but it's not run-down. It's polished, invit The place is empty save for Sebastian and an EMPLOYEE. It before-hours. Sebastian finishes playing. Feels out the lowest keys once more, then the highest. Then turns and -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, I'm done. (gets up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harris did a nice job with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Took him long enough. Sebastian smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one touches the instruments. Carson's coming an hour early to test levels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a check for you to sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd we do last month?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not too bad. Revision                          78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he signs the check)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not too bad is great. (taps the Employee on the shoulder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia pulls into the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steps inside. Flowers and cards. We glimpse cursive "CONGRATULATIONS" written on a few of them. A stack of sc on a nearby table. Her name visible. She drops her things spots someone, goes in to kiss him. A long, tender, lovin embrace, as we pull back... ...and see that it's not Sebastian. It's a MAN we haven't seen before: DAVID, mid-thirties. H and Mia kiss again. And, running over and grabbing Mia's is a TWO-YEAR-OLD GIRL...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian steps in. The place is more habitable than his digs. Fully furnished, warm and welcoming. He heads to th kitchen, pulls out some pork cutlets he's been thawing. W sitting on the counter, a Christmas card with a photo att Laura, Harry, and a FOUR-YEAR-OLD BOY, all gathered on a and smiling at the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian eats his meal, in a new shirt and pants. Checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian pulls up outside the club. New car, same style. Gets out and passes by a movie poster as he walks. We can't see the title, but we can catch a glimpse of a face on it. It's MIA...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're back in the club. Revision                       79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's bustling now -- the BARTENDERS setting up, DOORMEN coming in, MUSICIANS sound-checking. Sebastian enters, th musicians greet him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: King Seb!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hothouse Eddie -- miss me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like the desert misses the rain. And then -- we see a SAXOPHONIST we recognize. One of the Lighthouse players.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seb -- Edgar's bringing his horn tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Tell him to tune it, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not Edgar. Laughs, pats on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia, in a new outfit, crosses the living area and grabs h purse and jacket. David is by the door, jacket on as well Mia bends back around a sofa, where the GIRL we saw befor seated next to a nineteen-year-old baby-sitter, CHELSEA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye, sweetie. You be nice to Chelsea. The Girl nods. Mia kisses her forehead. Heads to the door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye, Mrs. Dolan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David drives, Mia seated beside him. They're on the 101. Gridlock traffic up ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if we miss this? What do we tell Natalie? Revision                      80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can just see it back in New York... David nods. Looks at the time on the car. 8:06.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia and David are seated. Still not moving. Mia looks at clock again: 8:27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to just skip it...? Turn off here and get dinner? David looks at her. Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia and David walk down a street. A few open restaurants bars, a few other closed storefronts. A lot of old, weath buildings: 1930's stucco, Art Deco signs. Then -- David's ears perk up. He hears something. MUSIC.. He looks around. Doesn't see the source. Heads to the end the block, then sees, just up ahead, a few people enterin building. Seems to be where the music's coming from... Mia heads over, curious. The music grows louder -- sounds a JAZZ COMBO. Mia peeks toward the door... ...and then FREEZES. The sign on the door reads: "SEB'S". It's written the way drew it for Sebastian, years ago... Coming up to her side, oblivious --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This looks fun. David edges past Mia. Glimpses the bar inside. Turns to h inviting --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on... Mia doesn't know what to say. She follows David... Revision                          81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside, a JAZZ COMBO is tearing through a fast bop chart. seats around the band are almost all occupied. Young fans older couples, passersby trickling in from outside. It's excited crowd, far more varied than what we saw at the Lighthouse -- a real range of ages and styles. Mia's eyes drift as David heads to the bar. She recognize images on the walls -- all Sebastian's. Recognizes a stoo the bar -- also Sebastian's, formerly Hoagy Carmichael's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia? She turns to David. Wavering, unsure what to do, she foll him as he manages to find two empty seats close to the bandstand... The combo finishes. Hearty applause. A young PIANIST rise from the keys, waves "thanks". And -- just then -- Sebastian appears. Mia looks at him, frozen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking the microphone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manny Halloran, ladies and gentlemen. (more applause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, I told him to play "Jingle Bells". The crowd laughs. Sebastian smiles, looks at them -- -- and sees Mia. Shock. The two LOCK EYES -- and you can tell it's the fir time they've seen each other in years. A prolonged silence. Sebastian is speechless. Then -- forcing himself to keep on a face --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to Seb's. More applause. Sebastian sits at the piano. Looks at the He seems uncertain -- perhaps unsure what to play. He loo Mia. Takes the sight in. Beat. Then looks at his fellow musicians. Murmurs to them. Then turns back to the keys - -- and finally starts playing. Revision                         82.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A quieter tune, just piano, soft and tender and melanchol melody we -- and Mia -- instantly recognize... It's Mia and Sebastian's song. Mia looks at Sebastian. He looks at her, then back at his This is the most beautiful we've ever heard his playing. most tender, and full of emotion, it has ever sounded. We MOVE CLOSER on Sebastian. We recognize this image. It recalls the visualization of his dream, back at the RESTA that night in winter, years ago. Gradually, as Sebastian plays, his surroundings seem to grow DARKER. Slowly, subt first, with just shifts in lighting, then a shift in perspective, the interior of the club changes, and soon.. 144   ...we find ourselves back at that same RESTAURANT.. Mia laid eyes on Sebastian for the first time... Within this fantasy-flashback, Sebastian finishes his pie We stick on Mia, watching him as his Boss talks to him. A as before, as we remember it... And sure enough, Mia approaches Sebastian as he walks near her, and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to say -- I saw your playing, and I -- -- but instead of brushing past her -- -- Sebastian decks her with a kiss for the ages. A BURST OF ORCHESTRAL MUSIC. The DINERS in the restaurant around to face Mia and Sebastian -- and SNAP their finger time. Even the Boss starts to DANCE. Mia and Sebastian gr and then strut out together, hand in hand... [EPILOGUE]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia and Sebastian push open a new door -- to their new pl It's a shabby one-bedroom -- but it's theirs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next, Keith approaches Sebastian at the Lighthouse -- but Sebastian immediately shakes his head "no".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian watches Mia perform -- it's the night of her pl He stands up to applaud -- and behind him, the entire theater, utterly packed, rises as well. A huge standing ovation. Mia's ROOMMATES are there, giddy with joy, as ar LAURA and HARRY... Revision                          83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mia and Sebastian walk together outside -- but now that w outside we realize this isn't the real L.A. at all.. This, in fact, is an L.A. that doesn't exist. A painted- backdrop L.A., just like the one we saw Mia pass by when parking on the lot... The old orange groves and the gabled rooftops and the mos covered bungalows and the ivy-decked lamps, the jacaranda trees and the giant hills and Griffith and the Santa Moni Pier -- all painted, all props, all figments of a studio- backdrop imagination. We've entered a fully fantastical realm, the realm of the old Hollywood ballets of the 40's 50's... A148     Everyone DANCES -- the pedestrians and the stree and the cops and the guards... AMY BRANDT races up to Mia seems to beckon her to audition... We see the audition silhouetted against a wall... We don't hear Mia sing, but music takes on the melody of her song, carrying us to... B148     PARIS... Sebastian travels there with Mia... We journey through an OLD GLOBE -- the same one we saw Mia u for her play -- a miniature plane and dissolves, the old- Hollywood-movie way... Finally, we find ourselves looking at a PAINTED BACKDROP Paris -- the same one Mia used for her play. The SacrГ©-C and the Arc de Triomphe and the Eiffel Tower etched in br colors, the ornate lampposts and the cobblestones stretch before us... And then a sign -- "CAVEAU DE LA HUCHETTE".. C148     We see a jam session at the Caveau -- a crypt-li Sebastian plays, on cloud nine... C148pt   We see a MOVIE SHOOT, Mia surrounded by lights a decked in movie-movie glow. We're BACK to the Caveau. The lights go out -- except for TRUMPETER, playing out a lovelorn solo, rim-lit. We MOVE close on his horn -- DIVE into the bell -- D148     -- and emerge into NIGHTTIME PARIS. All painted. Sebastian wander through this wonderland, pedestrians fro around them... Finally, they stop and look at one another And -- as the city lights behind them start to glitter li all the stars of the galaxy... ...they DANCE. Revision                        84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the last time we'll ever see them dance, and they seem to recognize that, so graceful and poised are their movements... Remember -- this is a romance more perfect t a real romance could ever be... We DISSOLVE again -- to a projector beam... 16mm footage plays on a screen, full of scratches and poc of light... Mia and Sebastian sit down to watch together and we see the following moments in brief, vivid GLIMPSES we move in closer on the imagery: 149   The first home... (16mm) 150   Mia's pregnancy... (16mm) 151   The newborn child... (16mm) 152   The child's first birthday... (16mm) 153   The child's first day of pre-school, all dressed up Everything here glows with the warmth of old home movies. These are memories, fluttering by, grabbed at random -- a yet all concocted, dreamed up out of nothing... The SCORE continuing to sway and taking us right up to... 154   Sebastian and Mia, husband and wife, father and mot hiring a babysitter because they've decided to go out for night at the movies... (We're back to 35mm now.) The look here is unaffected, just everyday. The MUSIC quiets sligh everything goes more natural, as this happily married cou hit the road... 155   ...then find themselves blocked by a traffic jam... a side route, winding up in another part of L.A... 156   ...then walk down the street, then hear music -- a playing somewhere... 157   ...and step into a place that looks just like Sebas club... They sit down to listen... And then -- and this is how our imagined montage-musical number ends -- the combo's PIANIST, who of course is not Sebastian, launches into Mia and Sebastian's melody... ...and Mia and Sebastian look at each other, recognizing The music goes full-circle, back to where it started, as and Sebastian look into each other's eyes, lean in and, softly, but with all the love in the world... ...KISS. Revision                           85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 158   WE CUT BACK TO THE PIANO: Sebastian has just finish piece. We're back to reality. The audience in the club applauds. Beat. Mia looks at Sebastian. Looks away. A moment passes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to stay for another? She's silent for a second. Then she looks at David.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... We should go. He nods. They rise from their seats and head for the exit Just as they reach the door, and as David steps out, Mia and looks back at Sebastian. He looks at her. Their eyes A hint of a tear in both... And, ever so subtly, for just a fleeting second, Mia smil It's the kind of smile you could miss if you blinked -- b it's enough to signal to Sebastian that she recognized th melody he played, and that she still remembers it, and st thinks of it to this day... Then she walks out the door. Sebastian glances at his fel musicians. Then, he nods, and they launch into a new char

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's silent outside. You can't hear the music. Mia and Da reach their car. They get in. It pulls out. Passing by Sebastian's club, the car continues on. We sta the jazz club on one side of the frame, the lights of the on the other. Those lights growing smaller and smaller, b finally disappearing into the big L.A. night... IRIS FADE OUT.
